subject: Programming
title: Cowboy Coding
description: Learn Cowboy Coding in one minute.

hook.text: No plans, no process, no tests. Just programmers writing code until it seemed to work.

buildup.text: Early software teams had no methodology. Each developer wrote code however they wanted.

discovery.text: Cowboy coding worked for tiny programs but collapsed under complexity. Bugs hid everywhere.

twist.text: Some startups still romanticize this style. Move fast and break things sounds exciting until things break.

climax.text: Methodology exists because cowboy coding taught us the hard way that freedom without structure fails.

punchline.text: Freedom without process is just chaos.

quiz.question: Why did cowboy coding fail for large projects?
